definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: 10th, Meng Xiangbin The wind whinny, the river water is cold, the brave soldier never to returns.
sentences.chinese: 风萧萧，江水寒，壮士一去不复返。

sentences.english: If on Candlemas day it be shower and rain, winter is gone, and will not come again.
sentences.chinese: 如果圣烛节下冰雹和雨水，冬天已经一去不复返。

sentences.english: Anika_Wu: Life is like a one way street, none of them leads back.
sentences.chinese: 人生就像一条单行道，一去不复返。

sentences.english: The capstone of the pyramid has been removed.
sentences.chinese: 金字塔的顶石已经一去不复返。

sentences.english: To mourn a mischief that is past and gone is the next way to draw new mischief on.
sentences.chinese: 为咯一去不复返地灾害而悲伤将会导致新地灾祸。

sentences.english: The age of the plunderer is past.
sentences.chinese: 掠夺者的时代已一去不复返。

sentences.english: Th trapped emotions that were released that formed the wall will be gone forever.
sentences.chinese: 压抑的情绪得到了释放，心墙将一去不复返。

sentences.english: The days of Mao suits and millions of bicycles are gone.
sentences.chinese: 毛装和百万自行车的时代已经一去不复返。

sentences.english: And it will be too late for you to go into scholarship when in your declining years .
sentences.chinese: 青春一去不复返，当进入垂暮之年再学已经太迟了。

sentences.english: The blue bird has gone without return;

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
just a while before/not so long ago/everyone can remember when..
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
